section.name: Cayenne Examples
section.p: Cayenne examples should be downloaded separately from Cayenne. Examples are normally not tested as thourougly as the core Cayenne code. They are provided mostly for reference and learning purposes.
section.panel: Please contribute your own examples if you think they may be helpful to the new users or demonstrate some unobvious use of Cayenne.
section.p: The following examples are currently available:

tr.td: Demonstrates how to use "derived" DbEntities for SQL aggregate functions, such as MIN, MAX, COUNT.

Demonstrates how Cayenne can be used to port relational data from one database to another. It shows the operation of the few internal parts of Cayenne, normally not used in the applications. DataPort also contains a working Ant task, so it has practical value for certain database maintenance tasks.

subsection.name: Installing and Building Examples
subsection.p: Most examples are distributed in a source form only, users must compile them using Ant buildfiles (build.xml) provided with each example. Generally the following steps are involved:
Extract contents of cayenne-examples-[version].tar.gz into Cayenne installation directory (the location is important for the ant build files to find Cayenne):
If an example contains cayenne.xml file, open it using CayenneModeler (if such file exists), set appropriate connection information for the DataNodes, and generate database schema.
